page.title: 06FARMING
page.content:
In 1956 West Fenton Farm was bought at auction by the present farmer's father.The farm is 541 acres and is divided into sixteen fields. Crops grown are wheat,barley,peas and{ swedes. They sell the produce to grain merchants or to a farmer's co-operative,Scotfresh.Some crops are used to feed livestock. The farm has 140 cattle ,the majority are Hereford cross cows.A Simmental bull is used with a Hereford cross to produce the biggest calf.The cattle are brought in for shelter in November and returned in April to pasture.
Home Farm ,owned by the Hamilton and Kinneil Estates ,has 1000 acres of land roughly divided into half forestry ,mostly conifers ,and half arable .There are six workers on the farm and they start work{(cont.P7)
